cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 75 mi S of Mobile, Alabama and 75 mi SW of Pensacola, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Very slow north to northeast motion, then inland across southeastern Alabama and into Georgia
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the AL/FL border, generally between Mobile Bay and Pensacola

weather_observation.watch_coast: Mouth of the Mississippi River to the Okaloosa/Walton County Line FL (Storm Surge Watch area noted in previous advisories)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning: East of Bay St. Louis MS to Navarre FL; Tropical Storm Warning: East of Navarre FL to Indian Pass FL and Bay St. Louis MS westward to Grand Isle LA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-central Gulf Coast from southeastern Mississippi through the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusts 20–30 mph possible in outer rainbands; sustained tropical-storm-force winds unlikely
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1-3 ft possible along the west-central Florida coast, including Tampa Bay, mainly around high-tide cycles
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain possible from outer bands Wednesday–Friday
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents through the end of the week
